SENT.plain: Growth and growth hormone (GH) were investigated every year in 24 children after allogeneic bone marrow transplantation (BMT) for severe aplastic anemia (SAA) or leukemia
Conditioning included total body irradiation (TBI) in all cases of leukemia
The young leukemic children grew poorly
At 4 years after BMT, the mean standard deviation score for attained height had decreased from 0 to -1.73
GH deficiency was diagnosed with provocation tests
Three years after BMT, 10/18 children had a subnormal response
Ten children were further investigated with 24-hour GH profiles
Children with SAA had normal growth and GH levels
TBI seemed to be the major factor responsible for impaired growth
